page.title: 02EMPLOYMENT, SHERBORNE
page.content: Though there is a high proportion of retired people in the area, Sherborne has a number of important employers. Major factories are Marglass, descr_ ibed separately, and Seymour's, a pro_ ducer and distributor of soft drinks for over a 100 years. There is also a creamery and engineering works. Incr_ easing use of machinery has resulted in a drift of workers away from agriculture. Woolworth's and Denner's department stores are leaders in the compact but comprehensive shopping centre. Local schools with boarding facilities also provide substantial local employment. Male unemployment in the area is at present 9.1%. School leavers are in_ creasingly resorting to the government sponsored job creation scheme which can provide the opportunity for train_ ing and perhaps a full_time job.
